isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - REASSEMBLE - SERIES 6 HOUSING REPAIR

step1.para: Place the new sector shaft oil seals in the housing and housing cover if applicable ( Figure 105).

figure.caption: Figure 105. Place New Section Shaft Oil Seals in Housing and Housing Cover

step1.para: Press bearing into position in the housing and housing cover. The bearing should bottom out against a shoulder so the bearing is flush with the inside surface of the housing or housing cover ( Figure 106).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Press Bearing into Position in Housing and Housing Cover

step1.para: To protect the oil seal, cover the splines on the sector shaft with wax paper and lubricate the paper and sector shaft with motor oil.
Align the timing mark on the piston and pinion gear.
Carefully install the sector shaft in the housing. Take special care not to damage the oil seals or leave dirt or contamination in the gear.
Align timing mark on piston rack with timing marks on sector shaft ( Figure 107).

figure.caption: Figure 107. Align Timing Mark on Piston Rack With Timing Marks on Sector Shaft

caution.para: If the rack is not properly timed to the pinion gear of the forged one-piece shaft and gear assembly, it is possible for the gears to disengage in service.

step1.para:
Use a new gasket or seal on the bearing cap to thread actuating shaft into the valve. Line up punch marks on gear housing and bearing cap. Turn shaft until cap comes into place on the end of the cylinder. Check plunger hole alignment with valve seat in the piston. Tighten bolts to specified torque ( Figure 108). Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

figure.caption: Figure 108. Tighten Bolts to Specified Torque

note.para: Variation - Several steering gear models use square ring seals in place of gaskets on the cylinder head and bearing cap.

step1.para: Position a new O-ring seal on housing cover. Install cover assembly. It may be necessary to use a soft hammer to tap the cover in place.

Install the bolts and tighten to specifications ( Figure 109). Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

The relief valve plungers may now be installed, using new O-rings. Coat O-ring with lubricant before installation. Turn them approximately six turns. Final adjustment of the plungers is made when the steering gear is installed on the vehicle ( Figure 110).

note.para: Variation - Later production steering gears may have slotted and recessed relief plungers. The later style plungers are removed or adjusted with a straight-bladed screwdriver. These plungers can be turned out until they are flush with the plunger boss. Turning them out beyond this point could cause an oil leak.

step1.para: Re-install the bracket on the steering gear and tighten the bolts to specification ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Re-install Bracket on Steering Gear
